definitions.definition: The conveyance or transfer of an estate, either in fee for life or for years, most commonly the latter.
Transmission by formal act or conveyance to an heir or successor; transference; especially, the transfer or transmission of the crown or royal authority to a successor.
The end of something, in a negative sense; downfall.
definitions.example: The lack of funding ultimately led to the project's demise.

definitions.definition: To convey, as by will or lease.
